net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource

Class CompositeResourceFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.CompositeResourceFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceFactory

    @Service
public final class CompositeResourceFactory
extends Object
implements ResourceFactory
    Creates resources that are a composite of several other resources. Underlying resources must not mutate their content type. This operates independent of locale.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • createResource

        public FactoryBasedResource createResource(String persistentResourceId)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceFactory
        Creates a resource object from a persistent resource ID. The meaning of the ID depends on the factory implementation. The intent is that the ID depends on the source of the resource, such as a database. In that case the ID would be the unique identifier in the database.
        Specified by:
        createResource in interface ResourceFactory
        Parameters:
        persistentResourceId - the peristent resource ID.
        Returns:
        Resource or null if the resource cannot be created, for example if it does not exist.

      • createResource

        public CompositeResource createResource(String contentType,
                               boolean cachingSupported,
                               FactoryBasedResource... fbr)
        Create a composite resource. The specified resources must all have the same content type.
        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type.
        cachingSupported - the cache supported flag.
        fbr - the factory based resources.
        Returns:
        the composite resource.

      • createResource

        public CompositeResource createResource(String contentType,
                               boolean cachingSupported,
                               List<FactoryBasedResource> fbr)
        Create a composite resource. The specified resources must all have the same content type.
        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type.
        cachingSupported - the cache supported flag.
        fbr - the factory based resources.
        Returns:
        the composite resource.

      • getFactoryId

        public String getFactoryId()
        Description copied from interface: ResourceFactory
        Get the ID of the factory. This ID is used to identify the factory and must be consistent across instances of the factory.
        Specified by:
        getFactoryId in interface ResourceFactory
        Returns:
        String.
